Question
========

A researcher is interested in the correlation between two normally normally distributed variables X and Y and to that end draws a random sample of 20 individuals from her target population. From this she calculates the following quantities. The value of the Pearson correlation coefficient is equal to

![](uva-correlation-328-nl-graph01.png)

Answerlist
----------

* -0.687
* -0.335
* 0.0012
* 0.687

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

-0.687: Correct
-0.335: Incorrect
* 0.0012: Incorrect
* 0.687: Incorrect
